subject: Re: Ant for building native applications (Re: [junit] Sun doesn't use JUnit. Why?)
msgSnippet: ... Actually there are some wildly underdocumented but very clever tasks in the ant-contrib project at Sourceforge . Go to
messageBody:
On Mon, 28 Apr 2003, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:

> So am I correct to paraphrase you this way? "There aren't the proper
> Ant tasks to support building native applications written in C/C++".

Actually there are some wildly underdocumented but very clever tasks
in the ant-contrib project at Sourceforge
<http://sf.net/projects/ant-contrib/>.

Go to <http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=36177>
and download cpptasks.

These tasks (transparently) support several compilers (from Microsoft
over Borland to gcc and IBM's C++ compiler for OS/390) - even Fortran
is supported - and feature built-in dependency checking. You don't
even have to specify the dependencies.

Stefan
